revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject United States|class=FA|importance=High|TX=yes|TX-importance=High}} {{WikiProject Military History|class=FA|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|US=yes}} {{WikiProject Mexico|class=FA|importance=High}} }}{{ArticleHistory |action1=FAC |action1date=00:06, 6 July 2008 |action1link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Grass Fight |action1result=promoted |action1oldid=223369398 |currentstatus=FA |maindate=October 11, 2008 }} == Vandalism == Sure looks like there is a fair amount of vandalism scattered through the article. Someone better than I at deciphering the history should clean it up. I'd make a mess. [[Special:Contributions/66.92.65.86|66.92.65.86]] ([[User talk:66.92.65.86|talk]]) 04:42, 11 October 2008 (UTC) == Texans == Surely it would be better to use the normal term for Texas residents, "Texans", rather than the strange "Texians" which is used throughout this article. [[User:EraNavigator|EraNavigator]] ([[User talk:EraNavigator|talk]]) 00:16, 11 October 2008 (UTC) :Did you read [[Texian]]? As far as I can tell there, the word refers to anyone of any color and language not of local Tejano heritage, especially during that time. --[[User:AnOddName|an]] '''[[User_talk:AnOddName|odd]]''' [[Special:Contributions/AnOddName|name]] 00:45, 11 October 2008 (UTC) ::We prefer "Taxicano" - and that should be the proper term used to refer to the Citizens of the Republic of Texas. Shall we change the article to this, or should I do it? [[User:Mwahcysl|Mwahcysl]] ([[User talk:Mwahcysl|talk]]) 18:27, 11 October 2008 (UTC) == FA == why was this nominated a FA? I've seen much better and through articles. '''''[[User:Vinsfan368|Vinson]]''''' 01:34, 11 October 2008 (UTC) :[[Wikipedia:Featured_article_candidates/Grass_Fight|This]] was the FAC. --[[User:Jbmurray|jbmurray]] ([[User talk:Jbmurray|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Jbmurray|contribs]]) 01:40, 11 October 2008 (UTC) ==Texian== Texian is a word that doesn't exist Texian is not the right name for people from Texas. It should be Texans and it is either the Texan Army or the Texas Army.—Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:145.116.224.173|145.116.224.173]] ([[User talk:145.116.224.173|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/145.116.224.173|contribs]]) :According to our articles on [[Texian]] and the [[Texian Army]] and references such as [http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/TT/pft5.html Handbook of Texas Online] and the [http://www.texasalmanac.com/history/highlights/forts/anahuac/ Texas Almanac] published by the [[Texas State Historical Association]], the word exists. -- [[user:zzuuzz|zzuuzz]] [[user_talk:zzuuzz|(talk)]] 11:21, 11 October 2008 (UTC) ::Do any outside sources refer to anyone from Texas and its history as Texians?[[Special:Contributions/68.210.221.194|68.210.221.194]] ([[User talk:68.210.221.194|talk]]) 22:38, 12 October 2008 (UTC) :::Yep, it's the standard term for pre-statehood Texans. It's fairly handy as a disambiguator. [[User:GeeJo|GeeJo]] [[User talk:GeeJo|(t)]]⁄[[Special:Contributions/GeeJo|(c)]] • 19:44, 14 October 2008 (UTC)
